page.title: 01Riding Mill Village.
page.content: Riding Mill village is near to the River Tyne in a valley.Nearly every way you look you see trees,hills and fields. Many of the houses are quite old. One of the oldest buildings is the Mill.Next to the Mill is The Wellington Public House which used to be the house of the Mill owner.Next to the youth centre there is a building which used to be the old school.There is a church next to the old school and new school which is in use now.The church is about 100 years old which is not very old compared to Bywell church.Which was built in the Norman times.The Village Hall is probably the most used place in the Village.It is used for gym, badminton and the Drama Club plays.The Youth Centre is used for Play school,Cubs and Brownies. Riding Mill is a good place to play.
